climbs.name: Wrath of The Lady Bug
climbs.fa: Laban Swafford, John Dorough, Zachary Lesch-Huie

content.description: Begin on obvious splitter crack to the right of Road To Nowhere.  Follow the crack to the face.  Climb techy face moves to the anchors

Begin on eye-level pockets left of the big crack.  Use face climbing and the crack to get to the high first bolt.  From here break left and follow the bolt line through the slightly steeper, but extremely fun and interesting 2-bolt crux.  Fight the temptation to use other lines to bypass blank-looking sections (the holds are all there), reach the first edge and mantle up.  Walk forward and continue another 20 feet up to a finish with a great view.
First arete right of Girlie Hands. Start on the right side in good jugs, work up and around left to stand up.

Open Project.  The name says it all.  Begin on thin arching seems to a really blank section protected by two bolts, this is the crux.  After this reach a more featured face and follow awesome moves to the chains.
content.protection: Mixed.  Thin gear for the bottom, 2 bolts + anchors

content.description: Easy climbing to a short corner followed by jugs, gorgeous swirled rock a sick pocket, long moves through vertical rock up high and a hero roof to finish. The dilemma is, do you take the sit down rest before the crux
content.location: Bolt line just left of Archer Left. Climb first fifteen feet of crack to clip high bolt out left

climbs.name: Moon Barrel
climbs.fa: Laban Swafford, John Dorough, Zachary Lesch-Huie

content.description: Start in the same crack as Mark of Cain.  This Line utilizes some fun/unique skills.  Follow the crack up to the roof, chimney your way out right of the overhang and follow a good crack to the anchors.

Open Project.  This is the first trad line right of the BackYard Cave.  Follow the crack to the open-book corner.  Move left out of the roof /arete to jugs.  Shake out, place good gear, and hope for the best as you work through an extremely blank crux face.  Finish on a good crack to the anchors

Begin to the right of the short cracks beneath the big hueco.  Climb through very techy bottom moves to a good stance.  Find great jugs out left and continue onto the upper face to the blank crux section.  Finish on better holds to the anchors before the big ledge.

This route is located on the wall directly back behind machine gun boulder.  Begin on fun face climbing to a tricky move to gain the slab.  Move through easy slab climbing up to a big jug beneath a small roof.  Pull the roof and climb big holds to the finish.

Slab to the right of the Archer cracks. Locate the two huecoes that eerily look like eyes staring down a sorority girl at a frat party. As a friend said, the climbing is like topping out a boulder problem over and over.
Twin cracks lead to a rest in an alcove followed by a thin crack
content.location: Far left side of MGA, just past slabs, obvious twin cracks

content.description: Climbs some need "changing corner" type features down right from Ice Cream Paint Job.  Start on a tricky slab move to gain the first crack/corner system.  Follow this through easy climbing into the second "corner system.  Climb to the top of this feature and make a long span to the final hold.  This last move adds the 9+ spice.

Slab climbing, starting in a shallow corner with neat pockets through creative and technical moves. Bring your fancy feet. 

  Death block above the anchors.
content.location: Just left of the first arete to the right of Girlie Hands

content.description: Closed Project.  Begin around the corner from Ketchup Man.  Move through a more challenging start to a good stance after the second bolt.  Trend left toward the arete through easy holds up the the ledge.  Break right a little bit to the anchors about 15 feet above the ledge.
Delicate moves off the ground followed by engaging climbing to the top. Stick clip the first bolt or you'll be sorry.
content.location: First bolt line left of Moral Dilema

content.description: Begin on the same bolt as Cold Black Coffee.  Follow the bolt line straight up through funky pockets to steeper black face.  Negotiate the crux to the ledge.  Finish on the last two bolts of Cold Black Coffee
Begin to the left of Cold Black Coffee.  Climb the black slab to cruxy face moves.  Finish on balancy thoughtful climbing to the anchors.  Give a soft catch for slab falls.

Fun corner with great gear and jams through a cruxy start. Offers a little bit of everything - jams, laybacking and locks. 

  There is a little bit of loose rock under the ledge in the middle, so be careful with your protection.
content.location: In a corner, around the arete from Cold Black Coffee.

content.description: The right of the two Archer cracks. Head up to a long undercling move around a huge shield feature. At the small roof either balance left and up or pull out from under it to a perfect face hold directly out the small roof. Finish on shared anchors

The left of the two prominent Archer cracks above MGB. Fun climbing to a little squirming in an acute corner. Scoot right on a horizontal at the top of the crack and head straight up the face to shared anchors
Home to many lost arrows recklessly slung by locals from the cliff tops. Up the hill just before the Machine Gun Boulder
